description: Single storey detached garden outbuilding for use as dwelling (1 Bedroom) (following demolition of existing)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s): Proposed Outbuilding 2024/12/BRH/OB Rev D | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D, E and F of Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any other order revoking and re-enacting that order, with or without modifications), no works shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of occupiers of adjoining properties and the appearance of the streetscene, in accordance with policies 1.1 (g) and (h) of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, and policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD.

| Prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development, details of the refuse and recycling storage shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include the number and capacity of bins, the location of storage and the materials for the store. The approved storage shall be brought into use prior to the first use of the hereby approved development and shall be permanently retained thereafter.
Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policy SI 8 of the London Plan (2021).

| Notwithstanding the information shown on the approved plans, further details of the hard and soft landscaping shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. All detailed works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of the premises. Such details shall include: the height and materials of the boundary treatment, the provision of planting in the forecourt and any new surfacing materials to be used.

Reason:  To improve the visual amenity of the property through urban greening in accordance with policies 5.10 and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies D8, G4 and G5 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | Prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development, details of the cycle storage facilities shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include the number and capacity of the stores, the location of the stores and the materials for the store. The approved storage areas shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development and shall be permanently retained thereafter.
Reason:  Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage in accordance with policy and T5 of the London Plan (2021).
